The Penreco facility, located in Karns City, Pennsylvania handles one chemical above the threshold quantity listed in the Risk Management Plan regulation.  Specifically, oleum is stored in an aboveground storage tank above the threshold quantity.

The worst case scenario was determined to be a failure of the oleum aboveground storage tank.  Since the facility is only an RMP Program Level 1, an alternate release scenario was not reguired or developed.  Mitigation measures to control the release include a concrete dike six feet in height that would be capable of containing > 100% of the volume of the storage tank.  Further, the tank is located approximately in the geographic center of the Penreco facility (not at the property border).  Penreco is prepared to handle a worst case release by training its emergency responders in Hazwoper Level 3, 40 CFR, Section 1910.120.  

Prevention steps include a strict inspection schedule, the implementation of numerous procedures, and carefully observing Process Safety Management guidelines.

There have been no accidents at Penreco in the past five years involving the regulated substance that have had an off-site effect.

A comprehensive emergency response program/plan has been developed and is regularly used to train both in-house and local responders.

To improve safety, Penreco is developing a local inter-company response group to deal with emergency situations at the member facilities.  Through membership, the groups would have access to additional equipment and personnel to handle the emergency situations.  Penreco is coordinating efforts at the local college level to further develop regulatory training for contract employees.  This training will be mandatory prior to employment at the facility.  Finally, Penreco is an active member of the Butler County LEPC.
